intro: Nemophila pratensis, commonly known as the meadow nemophila, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, hairy leaves and has a low, spreading growth habit. Nemophila pratensis is often found in areas with well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
